meanings.definition: The state or quality of being tedious.
meanings.sent1: The tediums of waiting in line at the grocery store can be unbearable.
meanings.sent2: She felt the tediums of the long, uneventful meeting creeping in.
meanings.sent3: The tediums of folding laundry seemed to never end, making her day feel longer.
meanings.sent4: The tediums of paperwork piled up on his desk like a mountain of boredom.
meanings.sent5: The tediums of counting each passing second made the clock seem to move slower.

meanings.definition: Boring or monotonous tasks or activities.
meanings.sent1: The tediums of data entry made her eyes droop with boredom.
meanings.sent2: He tried to break the tediums of his routine by taking up a new hobby.
meanings.sent3: The tediums of watching paint dry suddenly seemed like a thrilling activity.
meanings.sent4: The tediums of daily chores weighed on her like a heavy blanket of dullness.
meanings.sent5: The tediums of the repetitive task numbed his mind to the point of exhaustion.
